claim.text: The research team introduces a procedure for identifying “multimodal neurons” that convert visual representations into corresponding text.
claim.exact_quote: We introduce a procedure for identifying “multimodal neurons” that convert visual representations into corresponding text, and decoding the concepts they inject into the model’s residual stream.

evidence.evidence_text: We introduce a procedure for identifying “multimodal neurons” that convert visual representations into corresponding text, and decoding the concepts they inject into the model’s residual stream.
evidence.exact_quote: We introduce a procedure for identifying “multimodal neurons” that convert visual representations into corresponding text, and decoding the concepts they inject into the model’s residual stream.

claim.text: Multimodal neurons are selective for specific visual concepts across inputs.
claim.exact_quote: We show that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.

evidence.evidence_text: We show that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.
evidence.exact_quote: We show that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.

claim.text: Image prompts cast into the transformer embedding space do not encode interpretable semantics. Translation between modalities occurs inside the transformer.
claim.exact_quote: We find that image prompts cast into the transformer embedding space do not encode interpretable semantics. Translation between modalities occurs inside the transformer.

evidence.evidence_text: We find that image prompts cast into the transformer embedding space do not encode interpretable semantics. Translation between modalities occurs inside the transformer.
evidence.exact_quote: We find that image prompts cast into the transformer embedding space do not encode interpretable semantics. Translation between modalities occurs inside the transformer.

claim.text: Multimodal neurons inject related text into the model’s next-token prediction.
claim.exact_quote: We find that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.

evidence.evidence_text: We find that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.
evidence.exact_quote: We find that multimodal neurons operate on specific visual concepts across inputs, and have a systematic causal effect on image captioning.

claim.text: Decoding the language contribution of multimodal neuron uk to model output has the effect of boosting or demoting certain next-word predictions.
claim.exact_quote: As [Activation]i [grows relative to][ A]i[j] [(where][ j][ 6][=][ k][), the direction of mi approaches][ W][ k]out [A][k]i[ where][ W][ k]out [is one row] of weight matrix Wout.

evidence.evidence_text: As [Activation]i [grows relative to][ A]i[j] [(where][ j][ 6][=][ k][), the direction of mi approaches][ W][ k]out [A][k]i[ where][ W][ k]out [is one row] of weight matrix Wout.
evidence.exact_quote: As [Activation]i [grows relative to][ A]i[j] [(where][ j][ 6][=][ k][), the direction of mi approaches][ W][ k]out [A][k]i[ where][ W][ k]out [is one row] of weight matrix Wout.

claim.text: Ablating multimodal neurons degrades image caption content.
claim.exact_quote: When up to 6400 random units are ablated, we find that the probability of token c is largely unaffected, but ablating the same number of top-scoring units decreases token probability by 80% on average.

evidence.evidence_text: When up to 6400 random units are ablated, we find that the probability of token c is largely unaffected, but ablating the same number of top-scoring units decreases token probability by 80% on average.
evidence.exact_quote: When up to 6400 random units are ablated, we find that the probability of token c is largely unaffected, but ablating the same number of top-scoring units decreases token probability by 80% on average.
